InstallationÔÉÅ

This page explains how to install and set up the CryoGrid Optimization Automatization project on your computer.

PrerequisitesÔÉÅ

Before starting, make sure you have the following installed:

  • MATLAB R2022b or later

  • MATLAB Toolboxes:

    • Optimization Toolbox

    • Statistics and Machine Learning Toolbox

  • Python 3.10+ (optional, only if you want to build the documentation locally)

  • pip packages for documentation:

pip install sphinx myst-parser sphinx-rtd-theme

Code launchÔÉÅ

Clone the GitHub repository to your local machine:

git clone https://github.com/username/CryoGrid_Optimization_Automatization.git cd CryoGrid_Optimization_Automatization

After cloning, the project folder should look like this:

CryoGrid_Optimization_Automatization/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/                                    # MATLAB scripts 
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ functions/                              # MatLab Optimization functions
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main_optimization_parallel/             # Main Matlab script, unique code to open                
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CryoGrid/                               # CryoGrid MATLAB 
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CryoGridCommunity_results/              # Files and Results of CryoGrid and Optimization outputs
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CryoGridCommunity_source/               # CryGrid code source files
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/                                   # Sensors data folder
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Daily_mean/                             # Exemple of sensor CSV files format
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Sensors_metedata.xlsx                   # Exemple of Excel sensor format 
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ forcing/                                # Forcing folder
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Forcing_Data/                           # Exemple of sensor .mat forcing files
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Forcing_code/                           # Code to create Matlab forcing file
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/                                   # Documentation (Sphinx / Read the Docs)

Data PreparationÔÉÅ

  • The data/Daily_mean/ folder contains example sensor CSV files. Make sure to follow the formatting of the template file.

  • For your own simulations, place your sensor CSV files in data/Daily_mean/.

  • .mat forcing files should be placed in forcing/Forcing_Data/. Make sure to follow the formatting of the template file.

  • Ensure that file names match the sensor ID used in your MATLAB scripts and in the PAPROG_Data_set.xlsx file.

MATLAB PathÔÉÅ

Before running any scripts, add the src/, CryoGrid/, data/ and forcing/ folders and subfolders to the MATLAB path in MATLAB:

Exemple : matlab
addpath(genpath('path_to_project/src'))
addpath(genpath('path_to_project/CryoGrid'))
addpath(genpath('path_to_project/data'))
addpath(genpath('path_to_project/forcing'))
